alert.note: Alert for Jack; Young (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:24AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Young and Jack Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 523 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Bellevue to 7 miles east of Elbert. Movement was southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Graham, Jacksboro, Olney, Bryson, Newport, Lake Graham, Fort Richardson State Park, Elbert, Lake Bridgeport, Possum Kingdom Lake, Newcastle, Perrin, Cundiff, Lost Creek Reservoir, Murray, Loving, Gibtown, Joplin, Bartons Chapel and Wizard Wells. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for north central Texas.
